data.title: Nelson Mandela footbridge
data.meta_description:
Zoetermeer
	Netherlands
	
	The Nelson Mandela Bridge in Zoetermeer, a bicycle and pedestrian bridge, was built in 1992. It is 180 meters long and connects Het Plein van de Verenigde Naties  (Square of the United Nations} in the Rokkeveen district, south of the highway A12, with the Boerhaavelaan. It 's not only crossing the highway, but also two railroad-lines.
	
	The bridge was designed by the architect J. Bak. He created a totally enclosed bridge in blue-yellow, the colors of the coat of arms of Zoetermeer. The artwork on the bridge, an undulating stainless steel band that separates pedestrian and bicycle path, is a work of the artist Arnold Hamelberg.
data.text:
Zoetermeer

Netherlands

The Nelson Mandela Bridge in Zoetermeer, a bicycle and pedestrian bridge, was built in 1992. It is 180 meters long and connects Het Plein van de Verenigde Naties (Square of the United Nations} in the Rokkeveen district, south of the highway A12, with the Boerhaavelaan. It 's not only crossing the highway, but also two railroad-lines.

The bridge was designed by the architect J. Bak. He created a totally enclosed bridge in blue-yellow, the colors of the coat of arms of Zoetermeer. The artwork on the bridge, an undulating stainless steel band that separates pedestrian and bicycle path, is a work of the artist Arnold Hamelberg.
